headings.usage: Use Manrope for all headings and data values (e.g., AQI numbers). It is modern and geometric.

body.usage: Use Inter for body text, labels, and long-form content. High legibility.

colors.rules: Use light mode by default. Use Slate-50 for app background to reduce eye strain. Use AQI colors ONLY for data points, not for decoration.

layout.spacing: Generous. Use p-6 or p-8 for cards. Gap-6 for grids.
layout.border_radius: rounded-xl (12px) for cards, rounded-full for buttons.
layout.grid_strategy: Bento Grid. Mix distinct shapes (square stats, tall lists, wide maps).

buttons.primary: bg-slate-900 text-white hover:bg-slate-800 rounded-full px-8 py-3 font-medium transition-all shadow-lg hover:shadow-xl
buttons.secondary: bg-white text-slate-900 border border-slate-200 hover:bg-slate-50 rounded-full px-8 py-3 font-medium transition-all
buttons.danger: bg-red-600 text-white hover:bg-red-700 rounded-full px-6 py-2

cards.style: bg-white border border-slate-200 shadow-sm hover:shadow-md transition-shadow rounded-xl p-6

inputs.style: bg-slate-50 border-slate-200 focus:ring-2 focus:ring-slate-900 focus:border-transparent rounded-lg

visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: Use heavily on the Map View for floating controls (AQI legend, search bar).
visual_enhancers.gradients: Use subtle 'Airy' gradients (Slate-50 to White) for section backgrounds. NO harsh gradients.
visual_enhancers.shadows: Soft, diffuse shadows (shadow-lg) for floating elements. Crisp, tight shadows (shadow-sm) for dashboard cards.

images.description: India Gate in Fog/Smog - Use with dark overlay for Hero text readability.
Motorcycle in smog - Represents traffic pollution.
Clean garden with fountain - The goal state/safe zone.
Man with black smoke - Represents agricultural burning.
Woman using phone - Represents citizen reporting.

implementation_guidelines.charts: Use Recharts. Style them cleanly: remove grid lines where possible, use rounded bar ends, use the color palette defined above. Tooltips must be styled with white background and shadow-lg.
implementation_guidelines.maps: Use React-Leaflet. Use a custom tile layer (e.g., CartoDB Positron) to keep it grey/clean. Overlay colorful circles for AQI data points. Use a heatmap layer for the 'Pollution Heatmap' feature.
implementation_guidelines.accessibility: Ensure text contrast > 4.5:1. Use ARIA labels for all charts and map controls.
implementation_guidelines.mobile: On mobile, stack the bento grid. The Map should be interactive but not trap the scroll (use two-finger scroll or a 'tap to interact' overlay).

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. Setup the ThemeProvider to handle Light/Dark mode, but default to Light.
2. Create a 'Layout' component that includes the Navbar (with Admin/Public toggle for demo) and Footer.
3. Build the 'AQI Card' component first - it is the atomic unit of the dashboard.
4. For the Map, ensure you handle the 'window' object check for SSR (Next.js/React) if applicable, or just standard React useEffect.
5. The 'Safe Route' feature should be a UI mockup on the map (drawing a green line vs a red line).
6. Use the images provided for the 'Pollution Sources' section on the Landing Page.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style.

Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories (especially sponsor logos) = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable.
Create new components that match the style and conventions of existing components when needed.
Examine existing components to understand the project's component patterns before creating new ones.
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...).
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...}).
Use sonner for toasts. Sonner component are located in /app/src/components/ui/sonner.tsx.
